column3: Is this the same as #8547 ? Wasn't the conclusion to get people to use --refresh-keys\n

I think the old key is revoked

On Monday, September 5, 2016, Michael Ford notifications@github.com wrote:

> Is this the same as #8547 https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8547
> ? Wasn't the conclusion to get people to use --refresh-keys .
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com

Yes, the old key is revoked. So --refresh-keys is a good idea to get the revocation certificate, but not a replacement for updating the key this time.

ACK 46606af, verified that the key in this pull, 0xD5566241A0295FA9 is the same new key as I have on file for @btcdrak.
